author: wdiggle
body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] Write a descriptive title.
- [X] Make sure you are able to repro it on the [latest released version](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/releases)
- [X] Search the existing issues.
- [X] Refer to the [FAQ](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/docs/FAQ.md).
- [X] Refer to [Differences between Windows PowerShell 5.1 and PowerShell](https://docs.microsoft.com/powershell/scripting/whats-new/differences-from-windows-powershell).

### Steps to reproduce

We are in the process of upgrading from PowerShell 7.0.2 to 7.2.2 and noticed that whilst via RDP you can type in to the command prompt when accessed via Azure Virtual Desktop all you can do is copy and paste in commands; you cannot type. Updated PSREADLINE module per another article reporting a similar issue with no success.

If I deploy the preview release of PowerShell 7.3.0 r3 the command prompt works exactly as it should with no issues both via an RDP session and in Azure Virtual Desktop.

### Expected behavior

```console
PS> Get-Module
```


### Actual behavior

```console
PS>
```


### Error details

_No response_

### Environment data

```powershell
PSVersion 7.2.3
PSEdition Core
GitCommitID 7.2.3
OS Microsoft Windows 10.0.19043
Platform Win32NT
PSCompatibleVersions {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0...}
PSRemotingProtocolVersion 1.1.0.1
WSManStackVersion 3.0
```


### Visuals

_No response_

comments.author: daxian-dbw
comments.body: @SeeminglyScience Do you have access to an instance of Azure Virtual Desktop that can be used to reproduce this issue?

comments.author: SeeminglyScience
comments.body: I do not :/ PowerShell is blocked entirely on mine.

comments.author: theJasonHelmick
comments.body: Thank you @wdiggle  for submitting this issue. I haven't been able to repo this yet - our internal AVD is very restrictive.  Im in the process of accessing a full customer AVD to test this issue.

comments.author: theJasonHelmick
comments.body: @wdiggle - I spoke with the AVD team, and following their testing suggestions, could not reproduce this error. My testing environment is not the same as the customers, and AVD recommends that customers experiencing this problem file an issue so they can attempt to repo. The AVD team has recommended that customers file an issue in Feedback Hub from the AVD host encountering the issue. Please select the category “Problem”, followed by “Apps” and “Remote Desktop”. Screenshot below. ￼

comments.author: wdiggle
comments.body:
The key to testing is using the web client and not the AVD remote desktop client which works fine. Knowing the AVD team they will have tested using the remote desktop client app. For the moment we are finding that the preview installations work fine so will continue with that for now.

Thanks.

comments.author: msftbot[bot]
comments.body: This issue has been marked as external and has not had any activity for **1 day**. It has been be closed for housekeeping purposes.

comments.author: daxian-dbw
comments.body:
@wdiggle This was already fixed in the 2.2 version of PSReadLine by https://github.com/PowerShell/PSReadLine/pull/2632. The v7.2.x of PowerShell ships the v2.1.0 PSReadLine which doesn't have that fix. Please upgrade to [v2.2.6](https://www.powershellgallery.com/packages/PSReadLine/2.2.6) of PSReadLine. See https://github.com/PowerShell/psreadline#upgrading for instructions if you are not familiar with upgrading PSReadLine. For details about how the root cause is discovered, see the comment thread starting at https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/issues/17783#issuecomment-1211236702.
GitHub
GitHub - PowerShell/PSReadLine: A bash inspired readline implementation for PowerShell
A bash inspired readline implementation for PowerShell - GitHub - PowerShell/PSReadLine: A bash inspired readline implementation for PowerShell

title: Unable to use PowerShell 7.2.x in Azure Virtual Desktop
